Hi,

Id like to constantly crawl new domains and add them to the job by using 
the action directory.
I dont want add all my domains to the seed file becuase that are too 
many and there are new domains added all the time.
So my application checks the crawling speed from time to time and if it 
is too low and no .seeds file in the action dir Ill add a new seedfile.

1. For the initial start do I really have  to use a seeds file or is 
there a way to tell heritrix to check the actionfolder when the job is 
started?
2. What possibilities do I have when the job finished before I can add 
new seeds to the action dir or if the job finished before it checked the 
action dir again?

I did hope that heritrix has maybe something like a listener on the 
action directory and automatically picks these seeds up and if finished 
the job only sleeps and keeps checking the action directory.
But the only way I see now is adding a seeds file to the main directory 
and (re)start the job to get it running and checking the action 
directory again.
Did I miss something in the configuration or is this really the intended 
behaviour?


Regards,
Markus
